title: Ahead of December summit, Jaishankar meets Putin in Moscow
text:
External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met Russian President Vladimir Putin in Moscow on Tuesday during a gathering of Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) delegation heads.

The meeting followed Jaishankarâ€™s talks with Russian foreign minister Sergey Lavrov, where the two reviewed bilateral and global issues ahead of Putinâ€™s upcoming visit to India in early December for the 23rd Indiaâ€“Russia Annual Summit.

â€œCalled on President Putin along with other Heads of SCO Delegations this afternoon,â€ Jaishankar posted on X.

Called on President Putin along with other Heads of SCO Delegations this afternoon. ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³ ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡º pic.twitter.com/27GYuXbUEB â€” Dr. S. Jaishankar (@DrSJaishankar) November 18, 2025

In New Delhi, Putinâ€™s top aide Nikolai Patrushev met Prime Minister Narendra Modi to discuss maritime cooperation and ongoing preparations for the summit. The Russian Embassy said both sides reaffirmed interest in deepening defence, maritime and strategic collaboration.

Jaishankar and Lavrov also reiterated their commitment to a multipolar world order, continued coordination in platforms such as the UN, SCO, BRICS and G20, and reviewed progress on the 25th anniversary of the Indiaâ€“Russia Strategic Partnership.

PM Modi and Putin last met at the Tianjin SCO Summit in September.
